label: 住持
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: The highest Buddhist official of a Buddhist temple. Such officials were placed in charge of the Bonshaku-ji, Kajii-no-miya, etc. That at the Kajii-no-miya came to be called the Kajii-no-Miya, and in 1870 the Nashimoto-no-miya.
